abstract: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth Lewis on Thursday blamed much of the current credit crisis on lax regulation by state officials and said all “systemically important” financial institutions need some form of federal oversight.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth Lewis on Thursday blamed much of the current credit crisis on lax regulation by state officials and said all “systemically important” financial institutions need some form of federal oversight.

headline.main: BofA Chief Blames Regulators and GSE Flaws for Crisis
